header: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 107 of 2019 (Anvar Mahaboob Shaikh Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000558­2019

background.text: 1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure filed by accused no.1 in C.R.No. 11 of 2019 registered at Shahupuri Police Station Satara.

arguments.text: 2) Case of prosecution is that, deceased had taken loan from this applicant and one Ali Sayyad which was to be repaid alongwith interest. Though deceased repaid the loan with interest accused frequently asked him to repay remaining amount by which deceased got frustrated and committed suicide by hanging himself. Applicant has not given any loan to the deceased, so no further questions arose.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Case of prosecution is that, deceased had taken loan from this applicant and one Ali Sayyad which was to be repaid alongwith interest.
Though deceased repaid the loan with interest accused frequently asked him to repay remaining amount by which deceased got frustrated and committed suicide by hanging himself.
Applicant has not given any loan to the deceased, so no further questions arose.

arguments.text: 3) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 09.02.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 306, 504, 506 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code and under Section 39, 45 of Bombay Money Lenders Act. Accused was in Magisterial Custody since 10.02.2019. It is stated that, applicant has not committed any offence, deceased had borrowed loan from various financial institutions, applicant has nothing to do with the crime, investigation of crime has been completed, applicant is permanent resident of Satara, he is not likely to abscond, he is ready and willing to furnish security hence prayed for grant of bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 09.02.2019.
The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 306, 504, 506 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code and under Section 39, 45 of Bombay Money Lenders Act.
Accused was in Magisterial Custody since 10.02.2019.

It is stated that, applicant has not committed any offence, deceased had borrowed loan from various financial institutions, applicant has nothing to do with the crime, investigation of crime has been completed, applicant is permanent resident of Satara, he is not likely to abscond, he is ready and willing to furnish security hence prayed for grant of bail.

arguments.text: 3) The prosecution has filed say and strongly objected the same. The case in FIR is reproduced in say. It is further stated that, the allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is resident of Bihar state, he will not attend police station for investigation and will attend the Court during trial if released on bail, accused is engaged in illegal money lending, there is possibility of indulging in same type of crime.

argumentSentences.text: 3) The prosecution has filed say and strongly objected the same.
The case in FIR is reproduced in say.
It is further stated that, the allegations against the applicant are serious.

Applicant is resident of Bihar state, he will not attend police station for investigation and will attend the Court during trial if released on bail, accused is engaged in illegal money lending, there is possibility of indulging in same type of crime.

arguments.text: 4) Heard Advocate for applicant and learned A.P.P.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Heard Advocate for applicant and learned A.P.P.

arguments.text: 5) Considering the submissions, I have to mention that accused was in police custody for one day for the purpose of custodial interrogation. The alleged offence is abetment to commit suicide. Whether the allegations made by the informant constitute the offence of abetment, is the matter required to be concluded after evidence. Though it is submitted that the investigation is in progress in the matter, considering the allegations in FIR and the alleged role of applicant accused, he is no more require for the purpose of investigation. Though there is apprehension of his fleeing, I am of the opinion that, accused may be released on bail by imposing conditions. Hence, following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Considering the submissions, I have to mention that accused was in police custody for one day for the purpose of custodial interrogation.
The alleged offence is abetment to commit suicide.
Whether the allegations made by the informant constitute the offence of abetment, is the matter required to be concluded after evidence.

Though it is submitted that the investigation is in progress in the matter, considering the allegations in FIR and the alleged role of applicant accused, he is no more require for the purpose of investigation.
Though there is apprehension of his fleeing, I am of the opinion that, accused may be released on bail by imposing conditions.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 107 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused be released on bail on furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.25,000/­ with solvent surety of like amount with following conditions. (a) Accused to attend Shahupuri Police Station thrice in a week on alternate day commencing from Monday till filing of charge­sheet in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. (b) He shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence and shall report the Investigation Officer while leaving Satara City. (c) Bail before Lower Court.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :20th February, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 107 of 2019 (Anvar Mahaboob Shaikh Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000558­2019 
---header-ends---
1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure filed by accused no.1 in C.R.No. 11 of 2019 registered at Shahupuri Police Station Satara. 
---background-ends---
2) Case of prosecution is that, deceased had taken loan from this applicant and one Ali Sayyad which was to be repaid alongwith interest. Though deceased repaid the loan with interest accused frequently asked him to repay remaining amount by which deceased got frustrated and committed suicide by hanging himself. Applicant has not given any loan to the deceased, so no further questions arose. 
---argument-ends---
3) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 09.02.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offence punishable under Section 306, 504, 506 r/w 34 of Indian Penal Code and under Section 39, 45 of Bombay Money Lenders Act. Accused was in Magisterial Custody since 10.02.2019. It is stated that, applicant has not committed any offence, deceased had borrowed loan from various financial institutions, applicant has nothing to do with the crime, investigation of crime has been completed, applicant is permanent resident of Satara, he is not likely to abscond, he is ready and willing to furnish security hence prayed for grant of bail. 
---argument-ends---
3) The prosecution has filed say and strongly objected the same. The case in FIR is reproduced in say. It is further stated that, the allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is resident of Bihar state, he will not attend police station for investigation and will attend the Court during trial if released on bail, accused is engaged in illegal money lending, there is possibility of indulging in same type of crime. 
---argument-ends---
4) Heard Advocate for applicant and learned A.P.P. 
---argument-ends---
5) Considering the submissions, I have to mention that accused was in police custody for one day for the purpose of custodial interrogation. The alleged offence is abetment to commit suicide. Whether the allegations made by the informant constitute the offence of abetment, is the matter required to be concluded after evidence. Though it is submitted that the investigation is in progress in the matter, considering the allegations in FIR and the alleged role of applicant accused, he is no more require for the purpose of investigation. Though there is apprehension of his fleeing, I am of the opinion that, accused may be released on bail by imposing conditions. Hence, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 107 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused be released on bail on furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.25,000/­ with solvent surety of like amount with following conditions. (a) Accused to attend Shahupuri Police Station thrice in a week on alternate day commencing from Monday till filing of charge­sheet in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. (b) He shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence and shall report the Investigation Officer while leaving Satara City. (c) Bail before Lower Court. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :20th February, 2019. Satara
